intro: Casearia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered casearia, is a tropical shrub native to regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the genus Casearia. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
